description:
"Cute girls doing cute things in cute ways."

Everyday things make up the fabric of life, whether it's making friends, going to school, trying to make money, or celebrating a holiday. Ichigo Mashimaro is a heartwarming series that follows the daily lives of Itou Chika, her sister Nobue, and her friends Miu, Matsuri, and Ana.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

node.description:
__Non-anime roles:__
- Shenhe - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Sugar - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Dikke - Reverse: 1999 (VG)

[Profile](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/notomamiko/)

A Japanese actress, voice actress, and singer. She is married and has one kid.

**Non-anime roles:**
- Shinano - Azur Lane (VG)
- Emma - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Skirk - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Durandal - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Jun Kazama - Tekken series (VG)
- Mother - Avataro Sentai Donbrothers (Super Sentai) 
- Rella Melancoryphus Cygnus - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)
- Yi Xuan - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)

Saeko Chiba took up ballet at a young age with ambitions of becoming part of Takarazuka Revue. However, having failed the entrance exam for Takarazuka Music School in her third year of middle-school she joined the Minami Aoyama Shōjo Kageki Dan (南青山少女歌劇団, also called Nanshō for short) a stage group for teenage girls. Having had several lead roles over the three years she spent with the troupe, Saeko was then cast in the lead voice acting role of Kotori Haruno in the Sega Dreamcast game Diamond Daydreams. Having had a taste of being a seiyū and deciding that she preferred voice acting to performing on stage, Saeko decided to pursue the career full-time.

Saeko has also pursued a singing career with [Yuki Kajiura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077), who wrote music for some of the Nanshō stage shows, writing and producing almost all her material. Her first single was Koi no Kiseki, the theme song for the PlayStation game Meguri Aishite. She has since released nine singles and two albums, along with various character song and drama CDs. She has also performed theme songs for games such as Alundra 2 and Atelier Judie.

Saeko was also part of the group tiaraway with fellow Nanshō member [Yuuka Nanri](https://anilist.co/staff/95366). The duo released three singles and an album before breaking up on March 6 2005.

On August 26th, 2007 she married (on her 30th birthday), and on February 17, 2011 she gave birth to her first child, a daughter.

__Hobbies:__ Shopping
__Skills & Abilities:__ Dancing & Singing

[Profile](http://www.atomicmonkey.jp/jp/archives/talent/orikasafumiko) | [Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/orikasa_fumiko/) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/10327.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/fumiko_orikasa) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumiko_Orikasa) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%8A%98%E7%AC%A0%E5%AF%8C%E7%BE%8E%E5%AD%90)

She is a voice actress currently affiliated with Atomic Monkey. As a singer she is signed to Rondo Robe.
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_barasui)

Barasui is the pseudonym of a Japanese manga artist. He is most known for the manga series Strawberry Marshmallow, which has been made into an anime series and OVA. He also had a part in the Weekly Dearest My Brother series.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_barasui)

Barasui is the pseudonym of a Japanese manga artist. He is most known for the manga series Strawberry Marshmallow, which has been made into an anime series and OVA. He also had a part in the Weekly Dearest My Brother series.
[Website](http://takeshiwatanabe.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/VOTOM_Watanabe) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/渡辺剛_(キーボーディスト))
[Website](http://takeshiwatanabe.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/VOTOM_Watanabe) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/渡辺剛_(キーボーディスト))
[Website](http://takeshiwatanabe.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/VOTOM_Watanabe) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/渡辺剛_(キーボーディスト))

After graduating from Miyakojima Technical Senior High School, Kanbe moved to Tokyo and went to a Professional Training College while delivering newspapers to maintain himself. He joined Studio [Topcraft](https://anilist.co/studio/363/Topcraft) and as his first job he worked as production assistant on [Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind](https://anilist.co/anime/572/Nausica-of-the-Valley-of-the-Wind/).

In the late '80s and early '90s he worked on several NHK educational anime for children while he had his debut as director with the OVA [Ninja Ryuukenden](https://anilist.co/anime/619/Ninja-Ryuukenden/) in 1991. 

In 1997 he established Studio Garan with several employees of [Studio Junio](https://anilist.co/studio/280/Studio-Junio) (which he had previously joined). Garan was one of the subcontracting studios for [Cardcaptor Sakura](https://anilist.co/anime/232/Cardcaptor-Sakura/) and the episodes Kanbe directed garnered much attention. He left Garan in 2000.

More recently he's been mainly known for directing psychological and thriller anime like [Elfen Lied](https://anilist.co/anime/226/Elfen-Lied/), [Electromagnetic Girlfriend](https://anilist.co/anime/5177/Electromagnetic-Girlfriend/) and [The Promised Neverland](https://anilist.co/anime/101759/The-Promised-Neverland/).

After graduating from Miyakojima Technical Senior High School, Kanbe moved to Tokyo and went to a Professional Training College while delivering newspapers to maintain himself. He joined Studio [Topcraft](https://anilist.co/studio/363/Topcraft) and as his first job he worked as production assistant on [Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind](https://anilist.co/anime/572/Nausica-of-the-Valley-of-the-Wind/).

In the late '80s and early '90s he worked on several NHK educational anime for children while he had his debut as director with the OVA [Ninja Ryuukenden](https://anilist.co/anime/619/Ninja-Ryuukenden/) in 1991. 

In 1997 he established Studio Garan with several employees of [Studio Junio](https://anilist.co/studio/280/Studio-Junio) (which he had previously joined). Garan was one of the subcontracting studios for [Cardcaptor Sakura](https://anilist.co/anime/232/Cardcaptor-Sakura/) and the episodes Kanbe directed garnered much attention. He left Garan in 2000.

More recently he's been mainly known for directing psychological and thriller anime like [Elfen Lied](https://anilist.co/anime/226/Elfen-Lied/), [Electromagnetic Girlfriend](https://anilist.co/anime/5177/Electromagnetic-Girlfriend/) and [The Promised Neverland](https://anilist.co/anime/101759/The-Promised-Neverland/).
Commonly works with [Kou Matsuo](https://anilist.co/staff/100326/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大野広司)

1977, he joined Kobayashi Production, where he studied under [Shichirou Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/103964/). In 1982, he debuted as an art director on [Tonde Mon Pe](https://anilist.co/anime/6730/), and soon after that he left Kobayashi Production and took part in the founding of Studio Fuga with [Hiromasa Ogura](https://anilist.co/staff/105312/) and [Toshiharu Mizutani](https://anilist.co/staff/121908/). Later became, and is the current representative director of the studio.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/太田雅彦)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanzakihiro) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLww4xTaLWjpESsK2HzkkcA) | [Nico Nico Douga](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/1159685/mylist?ref=pc_userpage_menu) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/27557) | [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/user-658062794)

Animator, illustrator and composer.

Uses the pen name Hanasoumen-P (鼻そうめんP) or HSP for his Vocaloid work.

[Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoko_Ueno) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%8A%E9%87%8E%E6%B4%8B%E5%AD%90)

Youko Ueno is a Japanese recording artist. She has performed in the bands, Oranges & Lemons, Vita Nova, Marsh-Mallow, and Zabadak. She is also a notable musical composer, having written music for several anime series, most prominent being .hack//Legend of the Twilight, Azumanga Daioh (where one of her bands, Oranges & Lemons, also performs both theme songs), and Brigadoon. As of late, she has taken to calling herself simply Yoko.

(Source: Anidb)

[Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoko_Ueno) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%8A%E9%87%8E%E6%B4%8B%E5%AD%90)

As of late, she has taken to calling herself simply Yoko.

Originating from [Oh! Production](https://anilist.co/studio/234/).
